column4: Oh poo... I just set the wrong set of codecs to download :(  Is there a *HUGE* difference between ubuntu-restricted-extras and kubuntu-restricted-extras?
Okay well have you tried uninstalling it through wine?
If it's a windows client I assume she would use either wine or yucky cedega :|
It's not that hard to install, hehe
Just download the file like you would in windows and do sudo wine "nameofimVUinstallerhere.exe"
Oh poo... I just set the wrong set of codecs to download :(  Is there a *HUGE* difference between ubuntu-restricted-extras and kubuntu-restricted-extras?
You might find that useful alms
Possibly.  Ubuntu will have things specific to Totem and Gstreamer, and I'm not sure what Kubuntu uses.  Many likely will be the same, but there is definitely the possibility of differences.
Would I be okay in just installing the kubuntu restricted drivers then after this installs? Or should I yank out the ubuntu restricted codecs frist?
In just do both do you mean that I should remove it?  Or just install them both
In just do both do you mean that I should remove it?  Or just install them both
install both.  The only harm it will do is use an extra 20 MB or disk space or whatever, so I'm guessing that's not a big deal.
Yep, thought so but not in the mood to muck around if I break something hehe... thanks for the info :D
Actually hehe it actually only took up 1290k more ;)
